item.title: How I used bibtex and python to automatically generate my publications page
item.description: Basic Workflow Generate bibtex using references managed in Zotero Parse and edit metadata as necessary Write markdown documents for each entry in bibtex Transfer these documents to the content/publications directory Generate a list page for each article grouped and ordered by year The central goal of this script is to take a bibtex file and automatically generate a requisite markdown document per article with the necessary front matter to generate my publications page.

item.title: How I adapted Hugo to build and style my personal website
item.description: In order to personalize the theme I chose for my website, I initially forked the project on github and placed it in the themes/ directory of my website repo using git submodule add. I made a few minor changes to the html’s and css, but ultimately decided it would be simpler to leave the theme repo in the same state as it’s main repo. Hugo gives priority to the layouts found in the parent directory.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: This is an initial test of Hugo as a static site generator. So far it feels more powerful and polished than pelican. My next posts will explore the ways in which I have adapted Hugo and the theme coder-portfolio to my needs.
